refnamediv.refpurpose: standard GLib types, defined for ease-of-use and portability.

refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para:
GLib defines a number of commonly used types, which can be divided into 4 groups:
New types which are not part of standard C - gboolean, gsize, gssize.
Integer types which are guaranteed to be the same size across all platforms - gint8, guint8, gint16, guint16, gint32, guint32, gint64, guint64.
Types which are easier to use than their standard C counterparts - gpointer, gconstpointer, guchar, guint, gushort, gulong.
Types which correspond exactly to standard C types, but are included for completeness - gchar, gint, gshort, glong, gfloat, gdouble.

refsect2.title: gboolean
refsect2.para: A standard boolean type. Variables of this type should only contain the value TRUE or FALSE.

refsect2.title: gpointer
refsect2.para: An untyped pointer. gpointer looks better and is easier to use than void*.

refsect2.title: gconstpointer
refsect2.para: An untyped pointer to constant data. The data pointed to should not be changed.
This is typically used in function prototypes to indicate that the data pointed to will not be altered by the function.

refsect2.title: gchar
refsect2.para: Corresponds to the standard C char type.

refsect2.title: guchar
refsect2.para: Corresponds to the standard C unsigned char type.

refsect2.title: gint
refsect2.para: Corresponds to the standard C int type. Values of this type can range from G_MININT to G_MAXINT.

refsect2.title: guint
refsect2.para: Corresponds to the standard C unsigned int type. Values of this type can range from 0 to G_MAXUINT.

refsect2.title: gshort
refsect2.para: Corresponds to the standard C short type. Values of this type can range from G_MINSHORT to G_MAXSHORT.

refsect2.title: gushort
refsect2.para: Corresponds to the standard C unsigned short type. Values of this type can range from 0 to G_MAXUSHORT.

refsect2.title: glong
refsect2.para: Corresponds to the standard C long type. Values of this type can range from G_MINLONG to G_MAXLONG.

refsect2.title: gulong
refsect2.para: Corresponds to the standard C unsigned long type. Values of this type can range from 0 to G_MAXULONG.

refsect2.title: gint8
refsect2.para: A signed integer guaranteed to be 8 bits on all platforms. Values of this type can range from -128 to 127.

refsect2.title: guint8
refsect2.para: An unsigned integer guaranteed to be 8 bits on all platforms. Values of this type can range from 0 to 255.

refsect2.title: gint16
refsect2.para: A signed integer guaranteed to be 16 bits on all platforms. Values of this type can range from -32,768 to 32,767.

refsect2.title: guint16
refsect2.para: An unsigned integer guaranteed to be 16 bits on all platforms. Values of this type can range from 0 to 65,535.

refsect2.title: gint32
refsect2.para: A signed integer guaranteed to be 32 bits on all platforms. Values of this type can range from -2,147,483,648 to 2,147,483,647.

refsect2.title: guint32
refsect2.para: An unsigned integer guaranteed to be 32 bits on all platforms. Values of this type can range from 0 to 4,294,967,295.

refsect2.title: G_HAVE_GINT64
refsect2.para: This macro is defined if 64-bit signed and unsigned integers are available on the platform.

refsect2.title: gint64
refsect2.programlisting: G_GNUC_EXTENSION typedef signed long long gint64;
refsect2.para: A signed integer guaranteed to be 64 bits on all platforms on which it is available (see G_HAVE_GINT64). Values of this type can range from -9,223,372,036,854,775,808 to 9,223,372,036,854,775,807.

refsect2.title: guint64
refsect2.programlisting: G_GNUC_EXTENSION typedef unsigned long long guint64;
refsect2.para: An unsigned integer guaranteed to be 64 bits on all platforms on which it is available (see G_HAVE_GINT64). Values of this type can range from 0 to 18,446,744,073,709,551,615.

refsect2.title: G_GINT64_CONSTANT()
refsect2.para: This macro is used to insert 64-bit integer literals into the source code.

refsect2.title: gfloat
refsect2.para: Corresponds to the standard C float type. Values of this type can range from -G_MAXFLOAT to G_MAXFLOAT.

refsect2.title: gdouble
refsect2.para: Corresponds to the standard C double type. Values of this type can range from -G_MAXDOUBLE to G_MAXDOUBLE.

refsect2.title: gsize
refsect2.para: An unsigned 32-bit integer intended to represent sizes of data structures.

refsect2.title: gssize
refsect2.para: A signed 32-bit integer intended to represent sizes of data structures.
